v8:item.v8:content: Import data from external spreadsheet files (for example, Microsoft Office Excel, Microsoft Office Word, OpenOffice Calc) to catalogs.

To import data, fill the table using one of the following methods: - Copy data from an external file to the table (using Copy and Paste commands). - Save a blank table to file that can be filled in another program. Then import the prepared data.
Failed to insert the entered data into the list as there are no relevant data in the program.
%2 out of %1 entered rows will be added to the list.
The following rows will be skipped: - No mapping found: 8 - Mapping conflicts: 2 To view the skipped rows and select data to be added, click Next.
For some rows, no mapping or multiple mapping options are found. To add such rows, select the matching objects by clicking the Object column.

One-to-one mapping is not found for some of the imported data. Unmapped data will be skipped, or added as new records (depending on the settings). You can map the data manually by filling the %1 column.

Map the imported data to the catalog items. You can map the data multiple times by selecting different columns for comparison. You can also map individual table rows by selecting values in columns.
Depending on the settings, unmapped data will be skipped or new catalog items will be created for them, and mapped data will be updated or skipped.
Some values in the table columns have mapping conflicts (they are marked with red). They require manual mapping. If the application does not have matching data items, you have to enter them manually.
Select one or several columns for mapping the imported data to application data

You can edit created and updated items of %1 catalog by selecting multiple rows and clicking Change attributes. You can open individual items by double-clicking them. You can save the skipped rows to a file, edit them, and then repeat the import attempt.
Items skipped due to invalid data
Import the prepared data from a file to a table
Saves a blank table to a file for future filling. The following file formats are supported: Excel 2007 Workbook, CSV (comma delimited), and MXL spreadsheet.
Map the imported data to application data by the selected column
Opens a window with a list of conflicting items for manual resolving
